attributes.action: Permit VC Hero Gurkha Tul Bahadur Pun an 'indefinite leave to remain in the UK' visa
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Tul Bahadur Pun single-handedly stormed Japanese machine-gun positions during the Second World War.Yet, despite his illustrious record, his application to live in Britain has been refused.The old soldier was told: "You have failed to demonstrate that you have strong ties with the UK." Mr Pun who has a number of serious health problems, must hope he can survive the intervening months in his home in Nepal.He has a heart condition, poor eyesight, asthma, diabetes, high blood pressure and he requires daily medication which is not always available where he lives.Mr Pun, who receives a £132-amonth Army pension, wants to move here because of his health. Having the highest award this country can give allows Mr Pun the right to live here.His actions alone saved many lives, now its time we said a thank you.

reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
